title: Mother 'killed her two young daughters and husband after he left her'
text:
Damyrra Alcindor is charged with killing her daughters, Maxille and Damaya, and her husband Max Alcindor (Picture: Facebook)

A mother gunned down her two young daughters and her husband who had recently left her, police and family say.

Damyrra Alcindor allegedly shot her 10-month-old daughter Damaya, her four-year-old daughter Maxilla, and her husband Max Alcindor, 38, in the head before turning the gun on herself in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania on Monday night.

Police said the only survivor was Damyrra, who was found lying on top of a handgun with an apparently self-inflicted gunshot wound to the head – from which she ‘demanded not to be resuscitated.’

Acting Philadelphia Police Commissioner Christine Coulter called the situation ‘horrific’ and said ‘officers were actually crying at the scene.’

Homicide Captain Jason Smith told The State: ‘While being transported to Jefferson-Torresdale Hospital in the back of a fire rescue unit, she admitted to shooting everyone and demanded not to be resuscitated,’ adding that there had been a ‘domestic discord’ between Damyrra and Max over child support payments.

Damyrra was taken to the hospital in critical condition where she is being ‘held as (a) prisoner,’ Smith said. Authorities also recovered a handgun that was legally purchased the day before the shooting.

Max Alcindor was pronounced dead at the scene. The two girls were rushed to the St Christopher Hospital for Children, where they were later pronounced dead.

'Drunk mother made son, 12, drive her and his younger siblings home'

Smith said Damyrra was expected to survive after surgery.

Damyrra’s sister, who asked to remain anonymous, told NBC that Max recently left Damyrra.

A family member said Max recently left Damyrra and neighbors said the two began fighting regularly. (Picture: Facebook)

Another family member told ABC 6: ‘She seemed to be her normal self. I talked to her like 8:30 pm. She was doing good. We’ve been going to church and everything. I’m still confused I don’t know where the gun came from, I don’t even know why he was at the house this time of night.’

However, neighbors told a different story. One even said to Fox 29: ‘There was literally a fight every single day. I feel like they hated each other. There was a fight every single day.’

Damyrra Alcindor is charged with three counts of murder, child endangerment, and possessing an instrument of crime, authorities said.
